title: Ta-ra-ra-boom-der-ay! Victorian lettering on old music sheet
content:
Modern equivalent(s) for this lettering?

http://www.peopleplayuk.org.uk/guided\_tours/music\_hall\_tour/music\_hall\_stars/collins.php

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071010134720im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Ta-ra-ra-boom-der-ay_5325.jpg)

 [‹ (x) font used in many wordpress blogs - Lucida Grande {Lari}](http://web.archive.org/web/20071010134720/http:/typophile.com/node/30537 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Script in Cuba Style logo - Radio {Patricia} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071010134720/http:/typophile.com/node/33260 "Go to next forum topic")
author: pj76

comments.content:
Oh, that is a nice poster.  
Who designed it? Small characters on the bottom... something like W.T. Stannard?  
I have no idea of there are fonts that mimic this kind of lettering jobs.

[http://www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=victorian](http://web.archive.org/web/20071010134720/http:/www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=victorian "http://www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=victorian")

P22’s collection would cover some of these

[http://www.p22.com/products/victorian.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20071010134720/http:/www.p22.com/products/victorian.html "http://www.p22.com/products/victorian.html")

Tim

_or Letterhead  
http://www.letterheadfonts.com/_
(Mea culpa, and a thousand pardons, for mistakenly posting this in General instead of where it belongs: the Font ID forum. Blush.)
